    @allure.story("Aspect Critic Evaluation")
    @allure.description(
        "Validates that the model response remains aspect critic to the reference context for rest assured")
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    @pytest.mark.parametrize("get_multiturn_data", IronMan.load_test_data(feature_name, "multiturn"), indirect=True)
    async def test_aspect_critic(self, get_llm_wrapper, get_multiturn_data, logger, assertions):
        """
        Test to validate aspect critic score using reusable helper class.
        """
        logger.info(get_multiturn_data)
        sample, response, question_chathistory = get_multiturn_data
        evaluator = MetricsEvaluator(get_llm_wrapper)
        result = await evaluator.get_aspect_critic(sample=sample)
        logger.info(f"Aspect Critic Result: {result}")
>       assertions.assert_aspect_critic(result, threshold=0.7)

self = <utilities.assertions.Assertions object at 0x000001F226DF3470>
result = {'forgetfulness_aspect_critic': nan}, threshold = 0.7

    def assert_aspect_critic(self, result, threshold: float = 0.7):
        """
        Validate that the AspectCritic score meets the minimum threshold.
        Result comes as {'aspectname_aspect_critic': score}.
        """
        score_list = result.scores
        score = score_list[0] if score_list else None
        score = score['forgetfulness_aspect_critic']
    
        if score is None:
            raise ValueError("No score found in EvaluationResult")
    
        with allure.step(f"Validate AspectCritic Score ≥ {threshold}"):
>           assert score > threshold, (
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
                f"❌ AspectCritic score too low: {score}. "
                f"Expected > {threshold}. Aspect: {score}"
            )
E           AssertionError: ❌ AspectCritic score too low: nan. Expected > 0.7. Aspect: nan

utilities\assertions.py:107: AssertionError
